snippet: The strike, which was called in response to a Taliban attack in Sangin district, resulted in the deaths of a mother and five of her children.
abstract: American military claims responsibility and expresses regret for an airstrike that mistakenly killed six members of a family in southwestern Afghanistan. (M)

byline.original: By ROD NORDLAND; Taimoor Shah and Jawad Sukhanyar contributed reporting from Kabul, and Farooq Mangal from Khost, Afghanistan

lead_paragraph: KABUL, Afghanistan -- The American military claimed responsibility and expressed regret for an airstrike that mistakenly killed six members of a family in southwestern Afghanistan, Afghan and American military officials confirmed Monday. The attack, which took place Friday night, was first revealed by the governor of Helmand Province, Muhammad Gulab Mangal, on Monday. His spokesman, Dawoud Ahmadi, said that after an investigation they had determined that a family home in the Sangin district had been attacked by mistake in the American airstrike, which was called in to respond to a Taliban attack.

headline.main: U.S. Confirms Airstrike Wrongly Killed 6 in an Afghan Family
